author: Rub√©n Guerrero
title: Grave negligencia en una de las pruebas de las oposiciones: "La primera bola fue anulada de forma arbitraria"
text:
Las irregularidades en las oposiciones a docentes en Andaluc√≠a siguen dejando historias sorprendentes de situaciones tan surrealistas como injustas que han marcado el devenir de las pruebas de numerosos aspirantes. Las oposiciones han vuelto a quedar marcadas por incidencias que ponen en entredicho la transparencia del proceso. En C√≥rdoba, durante una de las pruebas desarrolladas el pasado fin de semana, se produjo un episodio que ha generado indignaci√≥n entre los aspirantes. El tribunal responsable del examen inici√≥ el llamamiento con diez minutos de retraso, sin ofrecer explicaciones claras a los presentes.
M√°s all√° de este contratiempo inicial, los opositores han denunciado lo que consideran una negligencia grave durante el sorteo de los temas. Seg√∫n el relato a lavozdelsur.es de uno de los voluntarios que estaba supervisando el sorteo, la primera bola extra√≠da fue anulada de forma arbitraria, alegando que ‚Äúel bingo no est√° lo suficientemente removido‚Äù. Esta decisi√≥n fue considerada como una falta de seriedad por parte del tribunal, que detuvo el procedimiento durante varios minutos para decidir los siguientes pasos.
Pol√©mica por la anulaci√≥n de una bola
Uno de los testigos presentes ha se√±alado que, tras una llamada telef√≥nica con la comisi√≥n de oposiciones, se decidi√≥ invalidar la primera bola bajo el argumento de que se hab√≠a ca√≠do, una versi√≥n que, seg√∫n los asistentes, no se ajusta a la realidad. ‚ÄúEl tribunal hab√≠a dicho que se hab√≠a ca√≠do, algo que no era cierto y que se hab√≠a expuesto como excusa para defender el fallo garrafal de su compa√±era de tribunal‚Äù, ha indicado un aspirante afectado.
Este incidente ha sembrado la desconfianza entre muchos opositores, que consideran que la actuaci√≥n del tribunal ha perjudicado directamente a quienes se hab√≠an preparado a conciencia durante todo el a√±o. La decisi√≥n ha sido vista como un acto de improvisaci√≥n que ha generado frustraci√≥n e impotencia en un proceso que deber√≠a regirse por criterios objetivos y garantistas.
"Seguimos dependiente de un bingo de juguete"
Las cr√≠ticas no han tardado en aflorar. ‚ÄúA√±o 2025 y seguimos dependiendo de un bingo de juguete y de la arbitrariedad de un tribunal sin ninguna preparaci√≥n‚Äù, ha expresado uno de los aspirantes. ‚ÄúLos damnificados siempre somos los mismos. Es una de tantas injusticias de las que he vivido en m√°s de diez a√±os de opositor. Y cada a√±o hay algo‚Äù, ha a√±adido, reflejando el sentir de muchos compa√±eros que han vivido situaciones similares.
Lo ocurrido en C√≥rdoba se suma a una serie de irregularidades que han sido reportadas desde diferentes puntos de la comunidad andaluza, lo que vuelve a poner el foco en la necesidad de reformar el sistema de oposiciones para garantizar la igualdad de oportunidades y la profesionalidad en su desarrollo. Mientras tanto, los aspirantes siguen pidiendo transparencia, seriedad y respeto a su esfuerzo.

author: AFP
title: Bient√¥t un an de d√©tention provisoire pour un policier qui vendait des fichiers confidentiels - 25/04/2024 √† 23:02 - Boursorama
text:
La d√©tention provisoire d'un policier qui a reconnu avoir vendu sur Telegram des fichiers confidentiels a √©t√© prolong√©e par une juge parisienne et pourrait d√©passer un an, une dur√©e rarissime pour un membre des forces de l'ordre ( AFP / STEPHANE DE SAKUTIN )
La d√©tention provisoire d'un policier qui a reconnu avoir vendu sur Telegram des fichiers confidentiels a √©t√© prolong√©e par une juge parisienne et pourrait d√©passer un an, une dur√©e rarissime pour un membre des forces de l'ordre.
Mercredi, une juge des libert√©s et de la d√©tention parisienne a prolong√© le mandat de d√©p√¥t criminel de K. C., 32 ans, mis en examen et incarc√©r√© depuis le 5 mai 2023 pour au moins 16 infractions dont faux en √©criture publique, corruption, escroquerie, violation du secret professionnel ou acc√®s ill√©gal √† des syst√®mes de donn√©es √©tatiques.
L'affaire commence d√©but 2023 apr√®s un signalement de la plateforme Pharos concernant un compte Telegram qui vend des faux documents d'identit√© ou des consultations de fichiers de police.
Apr√®s une rapide enqu√™te confi√©e √† la police des polices (IGPN) et √† l'Office de lutte contre le trafic illicite de migrants (OLTIM), M. A., soup√ßonn√© d'√™tre cet administrateur du compte, est interpell√© le 2 mai 2023.
Celui qui conteste la plupart des faits et qui est toujours d√©tenu a obtenu r√©cemment l'annulation d'une partie de la proc√©dure par la cour d'appel de Paris, concernant des donn√©es obtenues via SnapChat, selon son avocat Me Philippe Ohayon. Il a fait appel de son maintien en d√©tention que "plus rien ne justifie".
- Quelques milliers d'euros - K. C. est interpell√© le lendemain. Jusqu'alors, il officiait le jour au commissariat du XIIe arrondissement parisien.
La nuit, ce brigadier consultait des canaux Telegram. Dans l'un d'entre eux, un administrateur annonce chercher un fonctionnaire de police capable de consulter des fichiers.
A l'audience publique mercredi, l'avocate de K. C., Me Roxane Best, a soulign√© les difficult√©s alors rencontr√©es par son client: "Il vient d'avoir un troisi√®me enfant, un pr√™t pour l'achat de la maison, une √©pouse en cong√© parental". Et d'apr√®s l'enqu√™te et ses propres aveux, une s√©v√®re addiction aux jeux.
Il accepte donc contre r√©mun√©ration d'√©plucher divers fichiers: immatriculation des v√©hicules (SIV), personnes recherch√©es (FPR), ant√©c√©dents judiciaires (TAJ)...
Ses consultations, multipli√©es par sept entre 2020 et 2022, lui rapportent environ 10.000 euros, et clignotent dans plusieurs proc√©dures judiciaires, comme √† Nanterre, dans la messagerie Signal d'un protagoniste-cl√© d'un trafic de stup√©fiants international, ou √† Marseille.
Apr√®s son incarc√©ration en mai 2023, K. C. d√©pose une demande visant √† un placement sous bracelet √©lectronique. Rejet. Puis une demande de mise en libert√©. Refus.
A l'audience √† laquelle l'AFP assistait, la procureure a demand√© qu'il reste en prison, "pour emp√™cher la concertation frauduleuse avec les complices" - l'un d'entre eux reste √† identifier -, mais aussi pour "pr√©venir le renouvellement de l'infraction" ainsi que "mettre fin au trouble" provoqu√© par ces "faits qui portent atteinte √† la confiance en l'Etat".
- "R√©gime sp√©cial" - Me Roxane Best a √©voqu√© de son c√¥t√© sa "col√®re" et son "incompr√©hension" : "On se heurte √† un mur dans cette instruction. Aucune demande n'est accept√©e, alors que d√®s la garde √† vue", son client "reconna√Æt tout", y compris "la gravit√© des faits".
L'avocate a balay√© le risque d'une concertation, alors que "tout ce qu'il a dit a √©t√© retrouv√© dans son t√©l√©phone ou son ordinateur", tout autant que celui d'une nouvelle infraction : "Il est suspendu, il va √™tre radi√©, il sait que c'est fini. Comment va-t-il faire" sans acc√®s aux fichiers de police ?
Au moment o√π les autorit√©s s'alarment de la corruption de "basse intensit√©" dans la police fran√ßaise, l'avocate s'est √©tonn√©e du "r√©gime sp√©cial" d'une d√©tention exceptionnellement longue pour ce type de clients, en comparaison par exemple des quatre mois et demi √† l'√©cart du policier mis en examen pour l'homicide de Nahel en juin 2023.
Cet √©t√©, une telle mesure concernant un policier accus√© de violences √† Marseille avait d√©clench√© une fronde in√©dite dans certains commissariats. Le fonctionnaire avait √©t√© lib√©r√© apr√®s 40 jours.
K. C., v√™tu d'un jean, d'une micro-doudoune noire, barbe bien taill√©e sur un visage assez s√©v√®re, a lui r√©p√©t√© mercredi ses "regrets" et son absence de "discernement".
"Ca fait un an que je r√©fl√©chis √† ce que j'ai fait", a-t-il soulign√©, avant de repartir √† la prison de la Sant√©.
Son avocate a fait appel.

author: –ö–∞–≤–∫–∞–∑—Å–∫–∏–π –£–∑–µ–ª
title: Ingush authorities report reconciliation of feudist families
text:
07 January 2024, 23:05
Ingush authorities report reconciliation of feudist families
After requests from theologians and authorities, six families in Ingushetia abandoned their declared blood feud.
The
["Caucasian Knot"](/) has reported that on December 3, 2023, Chechen authorities reported that a reconciliation ceremony of two families from Ingushetia and Chechnya took place in Grozny; one of the families had declared blood feud to the due to the perished relative.
In Ingushetia, dozens of families, "meeting the requests made by theologians and authorities," decided to abandon their mutual hostility and conflicts, the head of the republic, Makhmud-Ali Kalimatov, has stated in his Telegram channel.
He treated the achieved results as "good." "Nevertheless, I find it necessary to intensify the work of the conciliation commission. It is necessary to more often inform republic's residents, especially young people, about the need to observe traffic rules, and to be restrained in actions that can lead to conflicts, sometimes with tragic consequences," says the channel.
In North Ossetia, the idea was voiced out that blood feud as a consequence of murder had kept people from violence, the author of the blog "Female Blogger. North Caucasus" that she runs on the
["Caucasian Knot"](/) has pointed out.
Back in February 2022, analysts pointed out that in North Ossetia, murders due to blood feud are rare; almost all conflicts are settled down within the legal framework.
Let us remind you that in Chechnya, neighbouring on Ingushetia, authorities
[are regularly reporting on reconciliation of feudist families](/articles/62202). Reconciliation [often occurs under authorities' pressure](/articles/62949), although in such cases hostility may actually continue, Ruslan Kutaev, the President of the Assembly of Caucasian Nations, has noted.
In 2010, Chechen authorities set up a commission for national reconciliation. However, despite the declared fight against the blood feud custom, in 2019, Magomed Daudov, the Speaker of the Chechen Parliament,
[declared blood feud to blogger, Tumso Abdurakhmanov](/articles/46455), for his words about Akhmat Kadyrov.
This article was originally published on the Russian page of 24/7 Internet agency ‚ÄòCaucasian Knot‚Äô on January 6, 2024 at 04:24 pm MSK. To access the full text of the article, click
here.
Source: Caucasian Knot

author: or for St. George News Sponsor
title: Restoring smiles, rebuilding confidence: Discover the expertise of St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry
text: CONTRIBUTED CONTENT ‚Äî In Southern Utah‚Äôs dental community, one name stands out for its unwavering commitment to excellence in prosthodontic care: the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry. ‚ÄúWe have a unique custom approach where we help people select the most appropriate and effective solution,‚Äù said Dr. Rodney L. Andrus, DDS, MS, FACP. ‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre confident in your smile, then you can do anything.‚Äù Andrus isn‚Äôt just the heart of the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry ‚Äì he‚Äôs also the only board-certified prosthodontic specialist in Southern Utah. He‚Äôs passionate about transforming lives through the art and science of dental restoration. With a wealth of knowledge and expertise in advanced techniques, he specializes in addressing complex dental issues, from missing teeth to extensive oral rehabilitation, with unparalleled precision and care. What sets the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry apart is its comprehensive approach to dental restoration, encompassing a wide range of services tailored to meet each patient‚Äôs unique needs. Whether it‚Äôs dental implants, crowns, bridges or dentures, Andrus and his staff utilize the latest technologies and materials to deliver functional and aesthetically pleasing results. ‚ÄúProsthodontics requires planning, especially in complex situations,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúOur training is extensive.‚Äù One of the hallmarks of the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry is an unwavering commitment to patient satisfaction. From the moment patients walk through the doors, they‚Äôre greeted with warmth, compassion and personalized attention. The team takes the time to listen to each patient‚Äôs concerns, goals and expectations, ensuring that every treatment plan is tailored to achieve optimal results. Andrus and his staff also pride themselves on fostering a welcoming and comfortable environment where patients feel relaxed and at ease throughout their treatment journey. With a state-of-the-art facility and a team of friendly and knowledgeable dental experts, they strive to make every visit a positive and memorable experience. In addition to clinical expertise, they‚Äôre also committed to affordability and accessibility. They work closely with patients to explore all available options, including flexible financing plans, to ensure that high-quality dental care remains within reach for everyone in the community. When Andrus decided to become a dentist, he knew he wanted to work with the most extreme cases and make a significant difference in the lives of his patients. That meant specializing in prosthodontics, just like his father. Andrus, a graduate of Brigham Young University, attended dental school at the University of Iowa and served in the Air Force before completing specialty training in prosthodontics. He holds a master‚Äôs degree in oral science and certifications from both the American College of Prosthodontists and the American Board of Prosthodontics. He has called St. George home for 18 years, initially drawn to Southern Utah for its family-friendly atmosphere and opportunities for an active lifestyle. Over time, his practice has earned a reputation for compassionate care and dedication to patients. Andrus shared that the most fulfilling aspect of his work is witnessing patients reclaim the joy of eating their favorite foods, which often positively influences their nutrition intake. Moreover, the confidence boost that comes with an enhanced appearance greatly improves patients‚Äô overall quality of life. ‚ÄúJust the other day, one of my patients told me that they can finally chew salad again,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThese are things that a lot of us take for granted.‚Äù For those seeking top-tier prosthodontic care delivered with compassion, expertise and integrity, the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry is the clear choice. With a reputation built on excellence and a track record of transforming smiles, Andrus and his team are dedicated to helping patients regain their confidence and achieve optimal oral health for a lifetime. As the pioneer prosthodontist in Southern Utah, Andrus takes great satisfaction in serving the community and collaborating with fellow dentists in the region. Experience the difference that the St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry can make in your smile today. Call [435-674-3100](tel:435-674-3100) to schedule your appointment, or visit stgeorgedentalimplants.com to learn more. Written by JESSI BANG for St. George News. ‚Ä¢ S P O N S O R E D C O N T E N T ‚Ä¢ Resources - St. George Center for Specialized Dentistry | Address: 640 E. 700 South #104, St. George | Telephone: [435-674-3100](tel:435-674-3100)| Hours: Monday-Thursday, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. | Website . Copyright St. George News, SaintGeorgeUtah.com LLC, 2024, all rights reserved.

author: zee business
title: India aims to leverage tech to detect all small-scale severe weather events: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju
text:
India aims to leverage tech to detect all small-scale severe weather events: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju
While launching the yearlong 150th-anniversary celebrations of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Rijiju emphasised that weather and climate impacts are more pronounced than ever, and India strives to become a more climate-resilient country.
India aims to detect and predict all small-scale severe weather events through the augmentation of its weather observation network and the procurement of more powerful computing systems, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said on Monday.
While launching the yearlong 150th-anniversary celebrations of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Rijiju emphasised that weather and climate impacts are more pronounced than ever, and India strives to become a more climate-resilient country.
He said that although the IMD's forecast accuracy has improved by 40 per cent in the last five years compared to the preceding five years, challenges persist in predicting small-scale severe weather events such as cloudbursts.
TRENDING NOW
India aims to leverage tech to detect all small-scale severe weather events: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju
Banking sector Q3 results preview: NIM likely to remain weak for top lenders with minor improvement in asset quality
Income Tax Slab: Modi govt may increase tax exemption in Interim Budget 2024; may increase limit by Rs 50,000
HDFC Bank Q3 Results Preview: Net interest income likely to grow by one-fourth with steady asset quality
Gold and Silver rate today (January 15, 2024): Precious metals trade in green; yellow metal above Rs 62,500
RBI‚Äôs upcoming monetary policy stance, FIIs, crude, global central bank action among key factors to influence bond yield
Should you buy Wipro, HCL Tech, Dixon Tech, GCPL, Tata Consumer, HDFC Life, and other stocks today? Here is what brokerages suggest
To address this challenge, Rijiju highlighted the importance of augmenting the network of doppler radars and automatic weather stations.
The procurement of high-power computing systems will enable the IMD to run higher-resolution models, enhancing the ability to detect and predict all small-scale events in the future, he said.
"Everything depends on observations. The more observation capacity we have, the better our forecasting capacity," the minister added.
The meteorological department has already installed 10 doppler radars in the western Himalayan region and plans to establish 11 radars in the eastern Himalayan region, Rijiju shared.
He said India's rapid technological progress has greatly improved the accuracy of weather forecasts and life-saving early warnings, minimising the loss of lives during cyclones, heatwaves, and heavy rain events.
Rijiju said that climate change is impacting every sphere of society, with different sectors vulnerable to even small changes in climatic conditions.
"The least developed countries and developing nations are suffering more. We have to become more resilient to climate change and hazards," he said.
Citing a survey by the National Council of Applied Economic Research, Rijiju said that the IMD's warnings and advisories are assisting farmers and the fishing community in improving their financial status.
03:34 pm

author: archyde
title: Magic6 Lite, the new cell phone with unbreakable screen technology
text:
If you are one of the people who He is constantly anguished by the screen of your phone because with any carelessness it can be ruined, you have to know what this expert brand in smart devices implements.
You may be interested in: They promote innovation in AI in electronic devices during the MWC With the release of the new Magic6 Lite, the Chinese multinational seeks to offer a new range of cell phones that resist any fall while adding a improvement in your battery , hardware and capabilities photographic . Without leaving aside comfort and avant-garde design.
An in-depth look Specifically has Shield Glass, a development of the company, which increases shock absorption on the device, at a height of up to 1.5 meters, at each of the angles.
All its layers of protection ensure a screen free of imperfections. (Courtesy)
It should be noted that this technology has a five star certification provided by the Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale de Surveillance (SGS), a leading company in inspection, verification, testing and certification.
Human-Centered Visual Excellence Due to its high resistance, you will be able to enjoy its use to the fullest and without worries. 6.78-inch AMOLED curved screen which has a resolution ultra clear 1.5K a 100% DCI-P3 gamut and up to 1.07 billion colors, delivering ultra-clear visuals with sharp details and vibrant colors
Also read: Artificial Intelligence is promoted in public education in Mexico This smartphone follows the company‚Äôs commitment to offering quality products that ensure the well-being of human beings.
Therefore, they have also included a set of functions for eye protection such as 1,920Hz PWM dimming, low blue light, Dynamic Dimming and Circadian Night Display, so people who spend long hours in front of screens They ensure care of your visual health.
Capture moments like a pro But what good is a cell phone with a spectacular screen without a camera to complement it. That is why we have included a triple camera system which consists of a ultra clear camera 108MP, one ultra gran angular 5MP and one macro of 2MP.
The 108MP integrates a large 1/1.67 sensor inches and a wide opening of f/1.75 inches allowing you to capture more light and produce images with more vivid clarity.
This system also offers high optical quality with a zoom the 3X and an impressive motion capture engine, ensuring you get clear shots with fascinating detail.
You can take advantage of the motion capture of your camera to portray any situation (Courtesy)
In addition to the main camera, the 5MP ultra-wide-angle camera offers a 110¬∞ field of view perfect for capture landscapes group photos or architectural wonders and has a 2MP macro camera with a 4cm minimum focus length allowing the user to capture close-ups with incredible clarity and defined details
Resistant as a rock, beautiful as a butterfly Finally, we must not forget the striking design with minimalist and modern aesthetic which can be found in three colors : lava orange, emerald green and titanium white.
With a long-lasting battery 5,800mAh so you can enjoy the glamor and functionality of this device for up to three days without having to worry about recharging it
Combine your style with any of its three presentations. (Courtesy)
Thus, this cell phone becomes a reliable option for all those who require constant use of their smartphone. In addition to a quick option Well, all this is powered by the Qualcomm mobile platform Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 .
Which gives you 35% more GPU performance and 40% more CPU efficiency, allowing for productivity and entertainment without limitations whenever.
Remember that you can purchase this new smartphone starting today.

author: Inspector Clueso Community
title: United We Rule: Let's Cut the Drivel, Lock Up The Donald, and Move On
text: In Manhattan Criminal Court, for six weeks ‚Äúboth sides‚Äù (prosecution and defense) went at it. The jury‚Äôs political predilections spanned a wide spectrum (and, yes, represented ‚Äúboth sides‚Äù thereof). Still, it UNANIMOUSLY found the hush money mogul GUILTY ON SOME 34 COUNTS. Such diligence needs to be extended. This fall, what‚Äôs sauce for the jury box (12-0) should prove sauce for the ballot boxes (say, 180 million to a big, fat goose egg). At the end of the day, let‚Äôs face it. If we can‚Äôt send a bloated-yet-hardened, prolific, freewheeling felon packing (to the point of donning an orange suit to coordinate with his not-found-in-nature dermis), when can we hope to start to make America freestanding again (as opposed to crassly-and-criminally Trumped)? When we let it, history speaks volumes. For decades, tyranny, thy name has been GOP. Lest we forget: a half-century ago, we the people lay in thrall to tuskers Richard ‚ÄúTricky Dickie‚Äù Nixon (R), and his effectively hand-picked successor/savior, Gerald ‚ÄòPardon Me‚Äô Ford (R). Caught red-handed obstructing justice, evading taxes, and presaging the current, querulous quack from Queens, Nixon resigned the office he‚Äôd so vilely degraded. Alas, our reactions were not unanimous. Even before Lynyrd Skynyrd snarked ‚ÄúNow, Watergate does not bother me,‚Äù one could hear diehard Nixonites/future Trump cultists yawping those self-same words. (Sad.) For their part, ‚Äúliberal‚Äù institutionalists chirped ‚Äúthe [legal] system worked.‚Äù If only. In truth, what functioned in the face of GOPers‚Äô domestic despotism was Nixon‚Äôs self-inflicted, smoking gun-blasted wound: by sheer fluke and hubristic folly, he caught himself in the act (on audiotape). Even then, he refused to fork over the recordings; if you can believe it, a UNANIMOUS Supreme Court (featuring decent, pro-democracy Justices from, you guessed it, BOTH SIDES) declined to let him get away with shredding our rule of law. But still. Life under the specter of Presidential impunity went on. Better late than never, let‚Äôs toss the triple cheese whopper that Ford was anything but a vehicle for King Richard I. By enabling Nixon to evade accountability, Ford did NOT end ‚Äúour long national nightmare;‚Äù rather, he effectively institutionalized our collective somnolence to a point where so unscrupulous a usurper as Big Blonder could catch our flimsily guard railed power structure asleep, so to speak, at the wheel. So. Here we are- striving to avert deja coup (via the undead J6 juggernaut) all over again. In thrall to six rabidly elephantine ‚ÄòJustices,‚Äô let‚Äôs take a moment to salute 1974‚Äôs unanimous, non-partisan, pro-USA SCOTUS. In their own way, let it be stressed, they presaged 2024‚Äôs open-minded, integrity-steeped New York jury- as an object lesson in how ANY non-seditious, truly American vote must be cast. For instance: President Biden over Yardbird Blowhard. Talk about a no-brainer! And yet STILL Big News (literally and otherwise) sandbags the former- and effectively calls the horse race even. (Go figure!) And now November looms. At bottom, it‚Äôs the criminality, stupid. In the pot is a six-times-bankrupt, parental pelf-made, word-slurring, licentious, megalomaniac flop. Born rich, he stoops to personal lawbreaking while openly vowing to become a Nixonian, Constitution-crushing ‚Äúdictator?‚Äù Who does that??? In all honesty, from sea to sea (and from Waikiki to Wasilla) could there be many perps ANYWHERE less suited to preside over our elephant-stomped, Trump-ravaged domain? Sigh. If Dems can‚Äôt bring themselves to full-throatedly address that glaring, ghastly Hobson‚Äôs choice, history suggests that, starting 11/5, they may have no choice but to hold their piece till the cowed come home. (As Dan Rather used to sign off, ‚ÄúCourage.‚Äù For, crying out loud, the beloved country.)

author: Jack Baer
title: Stanley Cup Final: Oilers on verge of historic 3-0 comeback after blowing out Panthers to force Game 7
text: The Edmonton Oilers are one win away from a Stanley Cup title, a historic comeback and the first Canadian championship in 31 years. As for the Florida Panthers, it just has to hurt right now. With a 5-1 win in Game 6 of the Stanley Cup Final, the Oilers became the first team in 78 years to force a Game 7 in a SCF where they once trailed 3-0. Game 7 is scheduled for Monday at 8 p.m. ET in Florida (ABC, ESPN+). An Edmonton win would make the team only the second in NHL history to win the Stanley Cup after trailing 3-0, joining the 1942 Toronto Maple Leafs' stunning of the Detroit Red Wings. Only four teams total have overcome a 3-0 deficit at all, the most recent being the 2014 Los Angeles Kings. The good news for the Panthers is teams that once trailed 3-0 are actually 5-4 in Game 7s, with the 1945 Maple Leafs holding off a reversal of fortune by the Red Wings. Of course, the lopsided nature of Games 4 through 6 likely has the optimism low on the Florida side. It was a familiar story in Game 6, with the Oilers taking a three-goal lead in the second period for the third game in a row. That started with Leon Draisaitl finding Warren Foegele with a beautiful pass on a breakaway in the first period. Warren Foegele gives the Oilers a Game 6 lead üö® (via [@BR_OpenIce]) [pic.twitter.com/vozM5pdpLg] ‚Äî Yahoo Sports (@YahooSports) [June 22, 2024] Edmonton took a 2-0 lead 46 seconds into the second period, but then controversy arrived. Panthers have goal erased after razor-thin offsides review 10 seconds after the Oilers' Adam Henrique found the back of the net , Aleksander Barkov appeared to get that goal right back with what would have been his second goal of the series. However, the Oilers challenged the goal, arguing Sam Reinhart was offsides before the goal. Replays showed Reinhart's skate fully crossed the blue line within milliseconds of the puck crossing, but the referees eventually decided it was clear enough to overturn the goal. The Panthers' goal was overturned due to an offsides üòÆ (via [@BR_OpenIce]) [pic.twitter.com/xad74I40um] ‚Äî Yahoo Sports (@YahooSports) [June 22, 2024] Panthers coach Paul Maurice was visibly furious after the decision was announced. While the call looked impossible close on the ABC broadcast, Sportsnet had an angle that made the reversal more explicable. Not sure why ABC doesn't show this angle, but Sportsnet has that offside, plain as day. [pic.twitter.com/dwuf71NIg3] ‚Äî Alan Saunders (@ASaunders_PGH) [June 22, 2024] The Oilers struck one more time via Zach Hyman at the end of the second period, leaving the Panthers in a situation where they needed to overcome a 3-0 deficit to avoid blowing a 3-0 lead. Barkov made up a little ground early in the third with a gorgeous goal , but that was all Florida would get. Edmonton's Ryan McLeod scored an empty-net goal with 3:15 remaining to put the game away, followed by one more from Henrique for good measure. The Panthers could have made it harder for the Oilers, but they came up short on three power plays, continuing a string of 46 penalty kills in 47 shorthanded situations for the Oilers. Now, to avoid humiliation, the Panthers must completely reverse their performance from the past three games. At least they can say that's already been done once in this series. 2024 Stanley Cup Final (series tied 3-3) Game 1: Panthers 3, Oilers 0 Game 2: Panthers 4, Oilers 1 Game 3: Panthers 4, Oilers 3 Game 4: Oilers 8, Panthers 1 Game 5: Oilers 5, Panthers 3 Game 6: Oilers 5, Panthers 1 Game 7: Oilers at Panthers | Monday, June 24, 8 p.m. ET (ABC, ESPN+)

author: Kristinn Taylor
title: Biden's Gaza Pier Disaster: US Vessels Beached on Shore After Heavy Waves | The Gateway Pundit | by Kristinn Taylor
text:
Joe Biden‚Äôs $320 million floating pier built to deliver humanitarian aid to Gaza took another blow early Saturday when heavy waves sent four U.S. Army vessels servicing the pier adrift, with two ending up beached on the Israeli coast. No injuries were reported and the pier is reported to be functioning. The incident follows a report from earlier this week in which three servicemembers working the pier sustained non-combat injuries with one hospitalized in critical condition. News reports state little of the aid from the pier is reaching Palestinian civilians in Gaza. Statement by Centcom released Saturday morning: This morning (Gaza time), four U.S. Army vessels supporting the maritime humanitarian aid mission in Gaza were affected by heavy sea states. The vessels broke free from their moorings and two vessels are now anchored on the beach near the pier. The third and fourth vessels are beached on the coast of Israel near Ashkelon. Efforts to recover the vessels are under way with assistance from the Israeli Navy. The IDF is supporting the recovery efforts near the pier. No U.S. personnel will enter Gaza. No injuries have been reported and the pier remains fully functional. We will release additional details as they become available. Photos and videos: This caption for this early video of a beached vessel is incorrect, the pier was not destroyed and is still functioning. Wow, good construction ‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/4tGDb0hBZO ‚Äî Lord Bebo (@MyLordBebo) May 25, 2024 Fox News reporter Trey Yingst posted on scene video: ‚Äî Trey Yingst (@TreyYingst) May 25, 2024 Middle East analyst Seth Frantzman posted videos of efforts to free the vessels: ‚Äî Seth Frantzman (@sfrantzman) May 25, 2024 The beached American military vessels have become an attraction for the locals as well as a rare joint American-Israeli military operation: ‚Äî Seth Frantzman (@sfrantzman) May 25, 2024 ‚Äî Seth Frantzman (@sfrantzman) May 25, 2024 Two days ago the New York Times reported Biden‚Äôs pier effort to deliver aid to Gaza is ‚Äústruggling‚Äù (excerpt): U.S. Military Faces Reality in Gaza as Aid Project Struggles
The Pentagon predicted that a stream of humanitarian aid would be arriving in Gaza via the floating pier, but little relief has reached the besieged strip, officials acknowledged this week. In the week since the U.S. military and allies attached a temporary pier to the Gaza shoreline, Pentagon planners have come face to face with the logistical nightmare that critics had warned would accompany the endeavor. The Defense Department predicted that a steady stream of humanitarian aid would be arriving in Gaza via the pier by now, but little relief has reached Palestinians in the besieged strip, officials acknowledged this week. Several trucks were looted as they made their way to a warehouse, the U.N. World Food Program said, and the complexity of operating the pier project in a war zone is continuing to slow distribution. The problems, as expected, are on the back end of the operation. Looting of aid trucks has continued, officials said, and forced the World Food Program to suspend operations for two days. The U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees, UNRWA, suspended food distribution in Rafah on Tuesday, citing lack of security. It added that it had not received any medical supplies for 10 days because of closures and disruptions at the Rafah and Kerem Shalom border crossings. The project was always expected to be difficult. For one thing, White House policy does not allow U.S. troops to be on the ground in Gaza. So the Pentagon has the ability to start but not finish the mission, a situation one military analyst likened to having the engine of a car but not the wheels. The Wall Street Journal also reported on the initial failure of Biden‚Äôs Gaza pier on Saturday (excerpt): The U.S. Built a $320 Million Pier to Get Aid to Gazans. Little of It Has Reached Them.
Challenges to distributing food, water and other supplies continue; good alternatives to ground crossings prove elusive An ambitious U.S. effort to get aid into Gaza via a floating pier in the Mediterranean Sea has gotten off to a sluggish start, facing many of the same logistical challenges that have throttled broader attempts to ease the humanitarian crisis in the besieged Palestinian enclave. Trending: NBC News Reporter Stunned by Support for Trump From Black and Latino Voters at Bronx Rally (VIDEO) The Pentagon spent $320 million and engaged 1,000 soldiers and sailors to open a major maritime corridor last week, delivering on President Biden‚Äôs promise in March that the U.S. military would install a temporary dock off the Gaza coast for cargo ships to unload food, water and other supplies. Fourteen ships from the U.S. and other countries are involved in a mission supported by humanitarian groups and several nations including Israel.
